When a friend signs up and makes their first rental, you'll receive an app balance bonus that you can spend on your rentals.Your friends will also receive nice bonuses after registration.

aplication.title: Leave a request and we will call
aplication.name: Name

whoWe.company-p: We are a young company that has become the first hourly rental service for power banks (Power Bank) in Uzbekistan. The company was founded in 2020, and the first launch of the Service was held in 2021. In two years, we have gone through a thorny path of trial and error, which has now resulted in a constant stream of new users. We hope that we will continue to delight you with our service.
whoWe.founder1: Dilshod Bobomuradov - Co-founder, CEO, graduated from the Tashkent Financial Institute, 12 years in the manufacturing sector.
whoWe.founder2: Gordy Wu, WU ZHIXIANG - Co-founder, angel investor, graduated from Peking University, China. 10 years in the manufacturing industry. 5 years in the investment field.

collapse.answer1: Tap on a spot in the app to find out the hourly and daily rental cost. We round up to the next full hour. The first 3 minutes are free to check the power bank. The penalty for losing a power bank is 200,000 UZS + the cost for rental time.
collapse.answer2: Scan the QR code at the station or open the AppStore or GooglePlay. Just type "Yoou" in the search and download the app. Register with your phone number and link your card. Scan the QR code at the station and take the power bank. Return the power bank. Rental is charged only after the return! You can return the power bank to the nearest station — you’ll find it on the map in the app. Check how many slots are available for return.
collapse.question3: How to return the power bank?
collapse.answer3: Find a station with a free slot in the app — we’ll show the nearest one on the map. Insert the power bank into a working slot, press it lightly, and wait a few seconds. The light will turn on — check your rental in the app. If the time hasn't finished but you encounter a problem, call us at +998 99 197 04 04 — we’ll do our best to quickly resolve the issue and refund any overcharged amount.
collapse.question4: How to check if there are power banks or free slots?
collapse.answer4: Tap on a spot on the map in the app. In the bottom left corner, you’ll see how many power banks are ready for rental and how many slots are available for return.
collapse.answer5: Type-C, micro-USB, and Lightning for iPhone. Connect any cable you need — they are built into the power bank.
collapse.question6: How safe is the power bank?
collapse.answer6: Completely safe — like a regular charger. Our power banks are produced in compliance with all international standards and are fully certified.
collapse.question7: All slots at the machine are full, and I can't return the power bank. What should I do?
collapse.answer7: The most important thing: do not leave the power bank with other people — even if it’s a waiter. The person who rented it must return it. Check the map of charging stations in the app — you’ll find the nearest place with a free slot there.

couponPage.text: Register your number, download the application and make your first rental. Your friend will receive money on the application balance, and you will receive a coupon with a free rent for a day! To get it, go to the coupon section in the app menu and enter the code NEWREF. Click on the button to use the coupon. Attention! The coupon works once, regardless of the time of the perfect rental!

<title>Privacy Policy “YOOU power”</title>

<title>Terms and Definitions</title>
User — an individual registered in the “YOOU power” Application/Telegram Bot “YOOU power”, accepting the terms of this Agreement and using the Charging Device under rental conditions.
Licensor — POWER DISTRIBUTIONS LLC, a legal entity owning property rights and/or exclusive rights to the “YOOU power” Platform and the “YOOU power” Trademark and/or having obtained a license from the rightsholder to use the “YOOU power” Platform and the “YOOU power” Trademark under the terms of license agreements concluded with the Rightsholder. The Licensor manages the Stations, provides Users with Charging Device rental services, and ensures the operation of the Platform within the scope of the rights and powers it possesses and/or has been granted.
“YOOU power” Platform — a set of software and technical solutions, including the Application, Telegram Bot, Stations, and Charging Devices, enabling the rental of Charging Devices. The Platform and Charging Devices referred to as “YOOU power”, may also be designated as “YOOU” and/or “YOOU Share” in the Application, Telegram Bot, on the Website, in marketing materials, or other resources of the Licensee. All mentioned terms refer to the same Platform and Charging Device rental services provided by POWER DISTRIBUTIONS LLC / the Rightsholder.
“YOOU power” Application (Application) — a mobile application available in the AppStore and Google Play stores, intended for registration, rental of Charging Devices, management of settings, and payment for services.
“YOOU power” Telegram Bot — a bot in the Telegram messenger providing limited Platform functionality, including rental and support.
Station (Machine) — a device for storing, issuing, and receiving Charging Devices.
Charging Device — a portable charging device (power bank) with built-in cables for charging mobile devices.
Profile — the User’s personal account in the Application, containing information about rental status, payment history, and settings.
Website — the Platform’s internet site hosted at the domain address: <1>https://yoou.uz</1>, containing information about the service, tariffs, and terms of use.
Rental — the temporary paid provision of a Charging Device to the User for personal use under the terms established by this Offer. Rental begins at the moment the Charging Device is issued to the User and ends upon its return to the Station in proper condition or upon closure of the order through the Support Service. 

<title>1. General Provisions</title>1.1. This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as the “Policy”) is developed by POWER DISTRIBUTIONS LLC (hereinafter referred to as the “Licensor”), a legal entity owning property rights/exclusive rights to the “YOOU power” Platform and the “YOOU power” Trademark or having obtained a license to use them from the rightsholder based on concluded license agreements.
1.2. The purpose of this Policy is to establish the legal framework for processing personal (user) data and ensuring their protection in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
1.3. The Policy governs the collection, processing, storage, and transfer of personal data of Users utilizing the “YOOU power” mobile application (hereinafter referred to as the “Application”) and the “YOOU power” Telegram Bot (hereinafter referred to as the “Telegram Bot”) for renting Charging Devices.
1.4. The “YOOU power” Platform is intended for use by persons who have reached the age of 16, in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan. The Licensor takes additional measures to protect the personal data of minors, including limiting the scope of collected data and enhanced access control, in compliance with the requirements of the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan.

<title>2. Legal Basis for Processing Personal Data</title>2.1. The processing of personal data is carried out based on the following legal grounds:
• The User’s consent to the processing of their data.
• The legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan regulating relationships related to information and information technologies, as well as personal data.
• Agreements between the Licensor and the User, including but not limited to the Public Offer.
2.2. The User confirms their consent to the terms of this Policy by checking a box (checkbox) in the appropriate field during registration in the “YOOU power” Application or Telegram Bot “YOOU power”. Checking the box is a mandatory condition for using the Platform and indicates the User’s voluntary and informed consent to the processing of their personal data in accordance with this Policy.
2.3. By using the Application and Telegram Bot, the User confirms their consent to the terms of this Policy. By entering into any relationship with the Licensor as provided by this Policy, the User confirms their full agreement with its terms.
2.4. In case of disagreement with the terms of the Policy, the use of the Application, Telegram Bot, and any actions related to the processing of personal data are not permitted. 

<title>3. What Data We Collect</title>3.1. The Licensor collects the following personal data of Users:
• First, last name and father’s name;
• Permanent residence address;
• Phone number provided during registration;
• Email address provided during registration;
• Bank card details (number, expiration date, security code) for payment processing, provided during registration;
• Information about the use of the Application/Telegram Bot (activity logs, device location data upon return, rental history).
The Licensor and/or the rightsholder does not store the CVV code of bank cards (security code) in its systems but immediately transmits it via a secure connection to the acquiring bank without retention.

3.2. Automatically transmitted data when using the Platform:
• IP address;
• Information about the browser, software, and hardware;
• Wi-Fi network data, date, and time of access;
• HTTP headers, web beacons, pixel tags;
• Geolocation data (if permitted by the User).

3.3. Data is collected directly from the User during registration and use of the Application/Telegram Bot (Clause 3.1), as well as automatically through technical means (Clause 3.2).

<title>4. Purposes of Processing Personal Data</title>4.1. Personal data is processed for the following purposes:
• Identification of the User during the conclusion and execution of agreements and contracts, as well as ensuring the operation of the “YOOU power” Platform.
• Compliance with the requirements of the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan, including the prevention or suppression of illegal or unlawful activities.
• Notification of the User, including sending notifications, requests, responses, payment documents, settlements, and other legally significant documents.
• Sending promotional and informational messages, subject to the restrictions established by this Policy.
• Conducting analytics and studying user experience to maintain and improve the Platform’s functions, as well as to develop new services.
• Maintaining statistical and other studies based on anonymized data.
• Protecting the rights and interests of the Licensor, Users and third parties.
• The processing of personal (user) information is carried out strictly within pre-defined, lawful purposes and does not exceed their scope.

4.2. The processing of personal data includes any actions (operations) performed by the Licensor, with or without the use of automated means.
4.3. When processing data, the Licensor may perform the following actions.
• Collection, recording, systematization, accumulation, storage;
• Clarification (updating, modification), retrieval, use;
• Transfer (distribution, provision, access) within the framework of the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan;
• Anonymization, blocking, deletion, destruction. 

<title>5. Data Transfer to Third Parties</title>5.1. In cases where the ownership rights to the Application/“YOOU power” Trademark belong to the Rightsholder, all data provided by the User or available to the Licensor may be transferred to the rightsholder of the “YOOU power” Platform.
5.2. The transfer of personal data to the rightsholder of the “YOOU power” Platform is carried out solely for the purposes of ensuring the Platform’s operation, including technical support, functionality updates, and compliance with license agreements. Only the data necessary for these purposes is transferred, such as the User’s full name, phone number, email address, rental history, and bank card numbers, unless otherwise provided by legislation.
5.3. The rightsholder of the Platform is obliged to ensure the protection of transferred personal data at a level no lower than that provided by this Policy, including the application of technical and organizational measures, such as encryption and access restriction, to prevent unauthorized use, loss, or alteration of data.
5.4. The transfer of personal data to the rightsholder is carried out only with the explicit consent of the User to this Policy, expressed by checking a box (checkbox) in the “YOOU power” Application or Telegram Bot during registration.
5.5. Payment-related data is transferred to third parties (e.g., banks or internet acquiring systems) solely for payment processing, as well as to other parties to achieve the purposes of processing.
5.6. The Licensor may transfer data to analytical services to improve the operation of the Application.

<title>6. Protection of Personal Data</title>6.1. The Licensor takes technical and organizational measures to protect User data from unauthorized access, loss, or alteration, including encryption of bank card details and the use of secure servers.
6.2. The User is obliged to take reasonable measures to protect their account credentials. 

<title>7. User Rights</title>7.1. The User has the right to:
• Request access to their data;
• Demand correction of inaccurate data;
• Request deletion of data (if there are no legal grounds for retention);
• Restrict data processing in certain cases.
• Withdraw their consent to the processing of personal data.
7.2. To exercise these rights, the User may contact the support service via the Application or at the email address: <2>info@yoou.uz</2>. A response will be provided within 10 days.

<title>8. Notifications and Claims</title>8.1. In case of the User’s failure to fulfill obligations (e.g., payment arrears), the Licensor sends a notification through the Application, SMS, or a call to the phone number provided during registration. The notification is deemed received on the day of sending/calling.
8.2. Claims between the Parties may be submitted in written form or electronically to the email address <2>info@yoou.uz</2>. Electronic claims have the same legal force as written ones. 

<title>9. Data Retention Period</title>9.1. Personal data is stored for the duration necessary to achieve the processing purposes or until the User requests its deletion, provided this does not contradict applicable law.

<title>10. Policy Updates</title>10.1. The Policy is an open and accessible document, the current version of which is available on the Internet at: <3>https://yoou.uz/politika</3>. The Licensor reserves the right to amend the Policy unilaterally.
10.2. Users are recommended to regularly check updates to the terms of the Agreement. The publication of a new version of the Agreement or its amendments is considered an offer to the User to amend the terms of the Agreement. If the User disagrees with the introduced changes, they must cease using the “YOOU power” Application.
10.3. The Licensor may, at its discretion, notify Users of significant changes via the Application or email.

<title>11. Contact Information</title>11.1. For questions regarding data processing, the User may contact:
• Email: <2>info@yoou.uz</2>
• Address: Republic of Uzbekistan, Tashkent city, Mirzo Ulugbek district, Shahrisabz MCG, Buyuk Ipak Yuli massif, house No. 32, apartment No. 24.

<title>Main Terms of Use of the Platform and Charging Devices (Power Banks) “YOOU power”</title> <title>(Public Offer)</title> 
 <title>PREAMBLE</title> 
 By this public offer (hereinafter referred to as the “Offer”), POWER DISTRIBUTIONS LLC proposes to conclude an agreement for the provision of the right to use the “YOOU power” Platform and charging devices (hereinafter referred to as the “Agreement”) on the terms specified below with any individual who applies, meets the requirements of this Offer, and complies with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan. 
If you do not agree with at least one of the terms of this Offer, you may choose not to enter into this Agreement. In case of disagreement with at least one of the terms of this Offer, please refrain from accessing the Platform, using any services offered through the Platform, or registering an account (profile) for these services. 
Carefully read the text of this Offer! 
A person who fails to timely familiarize themselves with the terms of this Offer assumes all risks associated with possible adverse consequences. 
The right to use the “YOOU power” Platform and charging devices is provided within the territory of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
The Platform and Charging Devices provided under this Offer, referred to as “YOOU power,” may also be designated as “YOOU” and/or “YOOU Share” in the Application, Telegram Bot, on the Website, in marketing materials, or other resources of the Licensor. All mentioned terms refer to the same Platform and Charging Device rental services provided by POWER DISTRIBUTIONS LLC / the rightsholder. 

 <title>TERMS AND DEFINITIONS</title> User — an individual registered in the “YOOU power” Application, accepting the terms of this Agreement and using the Charging Device under rental conditions. 
 Licensor — POWER DISTRIBUTIONS LLC, a legal entity owning property rights and/or exclusive rights to the “YOOU power” Platform and the “YOOU power” Trademark and/or having obtained a license from the rightsholder to use the “YOOU power” Platform and the “YOOU power” Trademark under the terms of license agreements concluded with the rightsholder. The Licensor manages the Stations, provides Users with Charging Device rental services, and ensures the operation of the Platform within the scope of the rights and powers it possesses and/or has been granted.
“YOOU power” Platform — a set of software and technical solutions, including the Application, Telegram Bot, Stations, and Charging Devices, enabling the rental of Charging Devices. 
“YOOU power” Application (Application) — a mobile application available in the AppStore and Google Play stores, intended for registration, rental of Charging Devices, management of settings, and payment for services. 
 “YOOU power” Telegram Bot — a bot in the Telegram messenger providing limited Platform functionality, including rental and support. 
Station (Machine) — a device for storing, issuing, and receiving Charging Devices. 
Charging Device — a portable charging device (power bank) with built-in cables for charging mobile devices. 
Profile — the User’s personal account in the Application, containing information about rental status, payment history, and settings. 
Website — the Platform’s internet site hosted at the domain address: <link1>https://yoou.uz</link1>, containing information about the service, tariffs, and terms of use. 
Rental — the temporary paid provision of a Charging Device to the User for personal use under the terms established by this Offer. Rental begins at the moment the Charging Device is issued to the User and ends upon its return to the Station in proper condition or upon closure of the order through the Support Service. 
Agreement — an agreement encompassing the terms of the Offer, rental conditions specified in this document, the Application, and/or the Website. 
Deposit — an amount of money debited from the User’s bank card at the time of renting a Charging Device as security for the fulfillment of their obligations under the Agreement. Issuance of the Charging Device is carried out only after the deposit is made. 
The deposit is refundable upon the User’s request after the Charging Device is returned to the Station in proper condition in accordance with the terms of this Offer. In case of the User’s violation of the Agreement terms, including non-payment of rent, damage, or loss of the Charging Device, the deposit amount may be fully or partially withheld to cover the User’s debt. 

 <title>1. SUBJECT OF THE AGREEMENT</title> 1.1. The Licensor undertakes to provide the User, upon their request, with access to the “YOOU power” Application and/or “YOOU power” Telegram bot and/or other applications developed by third parties in which the Platform’s functionality is integrated, through which the User can rent a Charging Device for temporary possession and use (hereinafter referred to as “Rental”) under the terms of this Agreement. 
1.2. The text of this Offer contains the terms of the Agreement. By accepting the Offer in the manner provided in Section 2, the User concludes the Agreement.
 1.3. All additional conditions clarifying the provisions of the Agreement, including a detailed description of the Charging Device rental process, service costs, and technical requirements for use the “YOOU power” Application and “YOOU power” Telegram bot, are published by the Licensor on the Website and/or in the Application. This information forms an integral part of the Agreement. The User confirms that, prior to concluding the Agreement, they have reviewed this information, fully understand it, and accept it. By performing the actions specified in Sections 2 and 4, the User confirms their agreement with the terms of the Agreement and concludes it. 
1.4. The Licensor may engage third parties at its discretion to fulfill the terms of the Agreement without the User’s consent. At the same time, the Licensor guarantees the User access to the Application and the ability to rent a Charging Device for temporary possession and use.
 1.5. In cases where the property rights to the Application and/or the “YOOU power” Trademark belong to the rightsholder, all information and data provided by the User in the course of using the Platform and/or in connection with the Platform, as well as those available to the Licensor, may be and will be transferred to the rightsholder. The User expresses their consent to these conditions by accepting the terms of the Offer and/or concluding this Agreement. 
1.6. A non-exclusive license to use the Application is granted to the User within the territory of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
1.7. A User who fails to timely familiarize themselves with the terms of the Agreement assumes all risks associated with adverse consequences resulting from this.

 <title>2. PROCEDURE FOR CONCLUDING THE AGREEMENT (ACCEPTANCE OF THE OFFER)</title> 2.1. To conclude the Agreement (accept the Offer), the User must: 
• Download and install the “YOOU power” Application on a mobile device or use the Telegram Bot. 
 • Complete the registration form in the “YOOU power” Application or Telegram Bot, providing a phone number to which a verification message (SMS or via Telegram Bot) will be sent. 
• Confirm the phone number by entering the code received via SMS or Telegram Bot.
 • Review the terms of this Agreement and the Privacy Policy, which includes conditions for processing personal data. 
• Confirm agreement with the Offer terms by checking the box “I accept the terms of use” in the Application or performing a similar action in the Telegram Bot. 
 • Link a bank card or another payment method supported by the Platform. 
 2.2. Acceptance of the Offer is the entirety of the above actions performed by the User. Acceptance of the Offer signifies the User’s full and unconditional agreement with the terms of the Agreement, as well as with the provisions of all documents referenced in this Offer. From the moment of acceptance of the Offer, the Agreement is deemed concluded between the User and the Licensor. 
 2.3. All information posted in the Application and on the Platform’s Website forms an integral part of the Agreement. If the User disagrees with any provisions of the Offer, they must immediately cease using the Application. 
 2.4. A User may be any individual who has reached the age of 16 and possesses the legal capacity and competence to enter into a transaction. 
 2.5. The User guarantees that: 
 • He/she is at least 16 years old and possess the necessary legal capacity to conclude this Agreement and use the Services; 
 • Any information he/she provides to the Licensor while using the “YOOU power” Platform and Charging Devices is accurate, complete, and up-to-date (including a mobile phone number registered in their name, a bank card issued in their name, or other payment methods valid in the Republic of Uzbekistan, etc.); 
 • Their use of the “YOOU power” Platform and Charging Devices does not violate any requirements of the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan. 
2.6. The User undertakes to provide only accurate data, including phone numbers and payment details. In case of changes to personal data, the User must update them in the Application Profile. 
2.7. The Licensor is not responsible for the User’s use of another person’s personal data or payment details (bank cards, payment system accounts). The Licensor is not obliged to verify the identity of the User against the personal and contact data they provide. 

  <title> 3. ACCOUNT SECURITY (PROFILE)</title> 3.1. The User is responsible for the security of their Account, including login credentials and/or password. The User must log out of the system after each session when using the Website and leave the Platform by performing the appropriate actions. In case of disclosure of Account information to third parties, the User bears full responsibility for any losses and consequences of such actions. 
 3.2. In accordance with the terms of this Agreement, the User bears sole responsibility for all actions performed through their Account, as well as for their consequences (including, but not limited to, renting “YOOU power” Charging Devices, their return, disclosure of information, etc.), regardless of whether these actions caused harm to the User, the Licensor, or third parties. 
3.3. The User must immediately notify the Licensor through the Platform in case of detection of unauthorized use of their Account or any situation that could lead to its theft or loss. Upon receiving a notification of unauthorized use, the Licensor may temporarily block the User’s Account for up to 72 hours. 
3.4. The Account may only be used by the User personally and is not transferable to third parties. The User undertakes to: 
a) Ensure the confidentiality of their Account data and not disclose it to third parties;
b) Keep the Account login confirmation code secret;
c) Not transfer Account access data to other individuals;
d) Comply with all applicable laws and the terms of this Agreement regarding the use of the Account.
3.5. The User is responsible for all actions and transactions performed through their Account.
3.6. The Licensor places great importance on protecting the User’s personal data and the information of other users. If the User gains access to personal information or documents of other users as a result of using the Platform or interacting with other Users, they undertake to maintain the confidentiality of such data and not disclose it to third parties.

 <title>4. USE OF THE PLATFORM AND CHARGING DEVICE RENTAL RULES</title> 4.1. Functional Capabilities of the “YOOU power” Application: 
• Register and create a personal profile in the “YOOU power” Application; 
 • Review the rules for using the “YOOU power” Application;
• Link a bank card and manage payment information;
• Display the locations of Stations and the number of available Charging Devices on a map; 
• Find the nearest Stations with Charging Devices; 
 • Arrange the rental and return of a Charging Device to a selected Station by placing the Charging Device in an available slot; 
• Subscribe and manage a subscription (if such a feature is available);
• Use earned bonus points (coupons) for renting a Charging Device when available;
• Obtain information about current tariffs and available services;
• View the rental history processed through the “YOOU power” Application and/or “YOOU power” Telegram Bot;
• Contact the Support Service.
4.2. Functional Capabilities of the “YOOU power” Telegram Bot:
• Register and create a personal profile in the “YOOU power” Application (if such a feature is available);
• Review the rules for using the “YOOU power” Application (if such a feature is available);
• Link a bank card and manage payment information (if such a feature is available);
• Display the locations of Stations and the number of available Charging Devices on a map (if such a feature is available);
• Find the nearest Stations with Charging Devices (if such a feature is available);
• Arrange the rental and return of a Charging Device to a selected Station by placing the Charging Device in an available slot (if such a feature is available);
• Subscribe and manage a subscription (if such a feature is available);
• Use earned bonus points (coupons) for renting a Charging Device when available;
• Obtain information about current tariffs and available services;
• View the rental history processed through the “YOOU power” Application and/or “YOOU power” Telegram Bot;
• Contact the Support Service.
4.3. The User is responsible for the security of their Account, including login, password, and other access credentials. They must end their session with the Website and properly exit the Platform upon completion of use. If the User shares their Account details with third parties, they assume all risks and consequences associated with this, including potential losses.
 4.4. Finding Stations:
• Information about the location of Stations, their operating hours, the availability of Charging Devices, and free slots is available to the User in the Application.
• For accurate display of information in the Application, the User must ensure a stable internet connection and allow access to geolocation services on their device (if this feature is enabled).
4.5. Obtaining Charging Devices:
4.5.1. To rent a Charging Device, the following steps must be completed:
• Manually enter the Station number or scan its QR code;
• Enter bank card details for rental payment and select a payment method;
• Make a deposit in the amount specified in the “YOOU power” Application as the current amount at the time of concluding the Rental, as a guarantee of fulfilling obligations under this Agreement.;
• Wait for confirmation of the transaction from the Station; 
• Retrieve the Charging Device from the opened slot. 
 4.5.2. The Licensor is not responsible for errors in entering the Station number, bank card details, or their transmission to third parties. If, due to the User’s error, a Charging Device is unlocked at a different Station than the one selected, the User bears responsibility for any losses or damages in accordance with Section 8 of the Agreement. 
4.5.3. After receiving the Charging Device, the User must, within 3 minutes, check:
 • The functionality of the Charging Device (a green indicator or white strip is lit);
 • The integrity of the casing and connectors; 
• The presence and condition of built-in cables (USB Type-C, Micro USB, Lightning); 
 • The absence of external damage, graffiti, stickers, or other foreign markings; 
 • The complete assembly of the Charging Device. 
 4.5.4. If damages or malfunctions are detected during the check, the User must immediately report this to the Support Service and return the Charging Device to the Station, following the rules of the “Returning the Charging Device” section. The User is entitled to receive a replacement for a defective Charging Device. 
 If the User does not report malfunctions within 10 minutes of receiving the Charging Device, it is deemed issued in working condition. In this case, any subsequent damage or malfunctions are considered to have occurred during the rental period, and the User bears responsibility for them.
 4.5.5. The rental period for the Charging Device begins at the moment of its receipt and ends upon its return to the Station or closure of the order through the Support Service, but in any case, the rental period must not exceed 72 hours from the moment the Charging Device is received from the Station. The return is recorded in the Application under the “Order History” section.
 4.5.6.  In accordance with Section 9 of this Agreement, if the User continues to use the “YOOU power” Charging Device in cases where: 
 i. They were notified of its malfunction or received such information in another way;
 ii. They visually detected obvious damage or defects; 
 iii. Upon inspection, they determined that the Charging Device is damaged, malfunctioning, or unfit for use,  
he/she bears full and sole responsibility for any potential consequences. 
The Licensor is not liable for any damage caused to the User’s health or property, or to the health or property of third parties, resulting from the use of such a Charging Device. 
4.6. Using the Charging Device:
4.6.1. The User may use the Charging Device only for its intended purpose and is not entitled to transfer it to third parties, disassemble, modify, or apply foreign markings to it.
4.6.2. The Charging Device has built-in connectors for various mobile device models. The User independently selects the appropriate cable to charge their gadget.
4.6.3. If the Charging Device’s indicator goes off or turns red, it indicates a low charge level, and the Charging Device needs to be recharged.
4.6.4. When connected to a mobile device, the Charging Device first expends its own energy.
4.6.5. After fully charging the mobile device, it is recommended to immediately disconnect the Charging Device to prevent potential operational issues.
4.7. Safety Measures When Using the Charging Device:
4.7.1. The Charging Device is equipped with a lithium-ion battery, requiring compliance with precautionary measures.
4.7.2. It is strictly prohibited to:
a) Disassemble, compress, or puncture the Charging Device;
b) Immerse the Charging Device in water or allow contact with liquids;
c) Expose it to open flames or high temperatures (above 60°C);
d) Use the Charging Device in a bathhouse, sauna, or infrared chamber;
e) Connect more than two mobile devices to the Charging Device simultaneously;
f) Remove identification stickers, damage the casing, or apply inscriptions.
4.7.3. The Licensor warns that improper use of the Charging Device may pose a danger to life, health, property, and the environment. The User confirms that they are familiar with the safety rules and bears personal responsibility for complying with all requirements.
4.8. Rental Period:
4.8.1. The User may use the Charging Device continuously for 72 hours. If the rental exceeds this period, the Charging Device is considered unreturned, and until its actual return, it will be registered as lost.
4.8.2. If the Charging Device is not returned and not registered in the system within 72 hours, it is considered lost by the User. In this case, a penalty for loss is debited from the User’s bank card in the amount specified in the “YOOU power” Application as the current amount at the time of concluding the Rental, as well as the rental fee for 3 days of use of the Charging Device, calculated based on the current daily rate specified in the Application at the time of concluding the Rental.
4.8.3. As an exception to clause 4.8.2 of the Agreement, if the User returns the Charging Device after 72 hours from the start of its rental, the amounts previously debited from the User’s bank card, including the penalty for loss and the rental fee, specified in the “YOOU power” Application as the current amounts at the time of concluding the Rental, are non-refundable. In such a case, the Charging Device is not considered purchased and remains the property of the Licensor.
4.8.4. In case of loss of the Charging Device during the rental period, the User must:
1. Immediately report its disappearance to local police authorities, completing an official police report;
2. Notify the Licensor through the Platform within 24 hours of the loss.
4.8.5. Failure to comply with these conditions leads to legal consequences in accordance with applicable laws.
4.9. Returning the Charging Device:
4.9.1. After completing use, the Charging Device must be returned in working condition to the nearest available Station marked in the Application as available for returns.
4.9.2. The User must:
• Find a Station with an available slot;
• Place the Charging Device in the free slot, PRESS ON TOP OF THE CHARGING DEVICE AND HOLD FOR 3-5 SECONDS;
• Ensure that the device is secured, and a red light or any other light confirming successful return lights up on the Station (usually located next to the Charging Device slot);
• Wait for the TIMER TO STOP in the Application or for a message such as “Thank you! The Charging Device has been successfully returned” or another confirming notification to appear.
4.9.3. The returned Charging Device must match the one rented. Its number must correspond to the data in the Application.
4.9.4. Before returning, the User must ensure that the device is undamaged and free of external defects.
4.9.5. If, after placing the device in the slot, the TIME DOES NOT STOP in the Application or the message “Thank you! The Charging Device has been successfully returned” does not appear, the User must:
• Check if the Charging Device is correctly inserted;
• Repeat the return procedure;
• In case of failure, contact the Support Service and follow its instructions.
4.9.6. The rental is considered completed only after the TIMER STOPS in the Application or a return notification appears in the Application.
4.9.7. If the return of the Charging Device is not confirmed by the system, the rental remains active, and the User remains responsible for the device.
4.9.8. In case of damage or loss of the Charging Device, the User must immediately report this to the Support Service. Until the incident is registered, the rental remains active and subject to payment.
4.9.9. In case of damage or loss of the Charging Device, a penalty may be deducted from the User in accordance with the terms of Section 8 of the Agreement.
4.9.10. If a different Charging Device, other than the one rented, is returned, the order remains active until the original device is returned.
4.9.11. The deposit amount, paid as security for obligations, will be refunded upon the User’s request after the Charging Device is returned to the Station in proper condition in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
4.10. Limitation of Availability of Charging Devices and Stations:
4.10.1. The User agrees and accepts that:
(i) The Licensor does not guarantee that the “YOOU power” Charging Device will be available at the time and place required by the User, especially during periods of high demand;
(ii) The Licensor does not guarantee that the User will be able to return the Charging Device at any time after rental if all nearby Stations are full.
In case of inability to return the Charging Device due to the lack of available slots, the User must contact the Support Service through the Application for further instructions.

 <title>5. SERVICE COSTS AND PAYMENT PROCEDURE</title>5.1. The cost of services under this Agreement is determined as a license fee for using the Application during the rental period of the Charging Device, as well as a fee for the use and possession of the Charging Device in accordance with the selected tariff.
5.2. The license fee is included in the rental cost of the Charging Device, i.e., the license fee is part of the Charging Device rental cost.
5.3. The amount of the license fee, the cost of renting the Charging Device, and the payment procedure are regulated by this Agreement and the current tariffs posted in the Application and displayed in the receipt.
5.4. The Licensor may unilaterally change tariffs, notifying Users through their profile in the “YOOU power” Application or otherwise. Changes made do not apply to active orders.
5.5. The User must independently monitor tariff changes. The risk of not knowing about tariff changes is borne by the User. In case of disagreement with changes to the license fee or the cost of using the Charging Device (rental), the User must cease using the “YOOU power” Platform. Continued use of the Charging Device after changes are made is considered the User’s agreement with the new conditions.
5.6. The exact cost per minute, half-hour, hour, day, week, month, half-year, or other rental time interval is determined in accordance with the tariffs specified in the Application and/or at the Station.
5.7. By entering into an agreement to use the “YOOU power” Application and accepting the Offer terms, the User consents to the automatic deduction of funds from their account (bank card) to pay for the use of the “YOOU power” Application, rental of Charging Devices, fines, penalties, and other payments stipulated by the Agreement. The User acknowledges that instructions to deduct funds from their account (bank card) issued under this Offer clause are their own instructions, and the actions of the processing center and acquiring bank aimed at deducting funds under this Offer clause are performed with the User’s consent.
5.8. By registering in the Application and accepting the Agreement terms, the User agrees that, in the absence of sufficient funds on the linked card, the debt may be deducted from any other bank card registered in their name, even if it is not linked to the Application.
5.9. The deduction of funds (license fee for using the Application, payment for renting the Charging Device, and amounts of fines and penalties) under this Offer clause is carried out automatically upon meeting the following conditions:
• The User enters bank card details during registration;
• Automatic activation of the service for deducting funds from the User’s bank card upon the first payment;
• The User confirms the payment by pressing the “Pay” button, which constitutes consent to the deduction of funds.
5.10. The Licensor is entitled to verify the validity of the User’s bank card by blocking and unblocking an amount on the bank card account not exceeding the amount specified in clause 8.2 of the Agreement, or by other methods provided in the “YOOU power” Application and compliant with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
If there are insufficient funds on the card for renting the Charging Device, issuance of the device may be declined. All payments under the Agreement are made by deducting funds from the User’s bank card, the details of which are provided by the User in the Application. Such payments do not require additional confirmation from the User.
In the case of renting a Charging Device with a free trial period, no funds are deducted if the Charging Device is returned on time. If the system erroneously deducts funds after a timely return, the Licensor undertakes to refund this amount following the User’s request to the Support Service. The time for crediting funds to the User’s bank card account depends on the rules of the relevant internet acquiring system and the regulations of the organization servicing the User’s bank card account.
5.11. If the User lacks sufficient funds to cover the debt, the Licensor may deduct the required amount from any other bank card of the User, even if it is not linked to the Application.
5.12. In case of insufficient funds on all of the User’s bank cards at the time of deduction:
• Access to renting the Charging Device may be restricted;
• The debt remains the User’s responsibility and must be settled once funds become available;
• If payment is not made within 24 hours, information about the debt may be transferred to the card-issuing bank or a collection agent;
• If payment is absent for more than 15 calendar days, information about the debt may be submitted to a court for recovery in accordance with the procedure established by law.
5.13. Payments are accepted from bank cards supporting internet payments. The User undertakes to maintain a sufficient balance on the card to cover rental and other payments. Payment for services is made through the payment systems specified in the Application or directly through the “YOOU power” Application. The User agrees to the acquiring conditions before making a payment.
5.14. If the User fails to provide correct bank card details with a positive balance at the start of using the “YOOU power” Platform, the Licensor may refuse to provide the User with the Charging Device for use (rental) or issue the Charging Device with subsequent deduction of the debt from the User’s bank card.
5.15. Payment of the license fee and rental of the Charging Device is made in advance unless otherwise specified in the “YOOU power” Application.
5.16. The User undertakes to independently monitor information about the status and use of the “YOOU power” Application in their profile.
5.17. Following the deduction of funds from the User’s bank card, the “YOOU power” Application provides the User with a document confirming the completed payment.
5.18. In case of inability to deduct payment due to insufficient funds on the bank card, incorrect entry of bank card details, expiration of the bank card, or other reasons, the Licensor notifies the User of this through a message in their profile. The Licensor may inform the User of the need to pay the debt for using the Charging Device using the phone number provided during registration.
5.19. The User is charged a debt for using the Charging Device until its return, in the manner established in Clause 8.4 of this Agreement.
5.20. The Licensor may deduct the accrued debt amount from the User’s bank card once the User eliminates factors preventing the deduction of funds – as funds become available on the User’s card, as well as at any time before the User returns the Charging Device.
5.21. If the User does not eliminate obstacles to payment within 24 hours from the moment of notification about the inability to deduct payment, the Licensor may terminate the Agreement and end the rental by blocking the User’s access to the Application and restricting the ability to obtain another Charging Device subsequently.
5.22. If the User returns the Charging Device before the end of the paid usage period, no automatic recalculation is performed.
5.23. The rental continues until the Charging Device is returned or the order is closed through the Support Service.
5.24.  The Licensor may use intermediaries to accept payments, which does not affect the User’s payment obligations.

 <title>6. EFFECT OF THE AGREEMENT </title> 6.1. The Agreement is concluded for an indefinite period. 
6.2. When the User deletes their account, the Agreement is terminated.
 6.3. Termination of the Agreement ends the obligations of the Parties under the Agreement for the future, except for provisions regarding the liability of the Parties (including, but not limited to, compensation for damages and payment of penalties), settlements between the Parties, applicable law and dispute resolution procedures, confidentiality and rights to intellectual property objects, refund of the advance amount (if applicable), as well as other provisions that, by their nature, remain in force after the termination of the primary obligation.
6.4. The maximum rental period is 72 hours from the moment the Charging Device is received from the Station. The moment of rental termination is considered the return of the Charging Device to the Station or closure of the order through the Support Service.
6.5. Loss of the Charging Device by the User constitutes a breach of the Agreement, for which the Licensor may terminate the Agreement by blocking the User’s access to the Application and apply the liability measures provided for in the Agreement.

 <title> 7. OTHER RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE PARTIES </title>7.1. In case of loss of access to the Application or if there are grounds to believe that access to the Application has been obtained by a third party, the User must contact the Support Service by phone or email with a request to block access to the Personal Account. Risks associated with failure to fulfill this obligation are borne by the User. 
7.2. The User must immediately (no later than 1 (one) calendar day) notify the Licensor of the loss and/or damage of the Charging Device. In case of failure to fulfill this obligation, the Licensor may demand compensation from the User for the cost of the Charging Device, regardless of the reasons and circumstances of its loss or damage.
7.3. The Licensor may assign its rights to collect debts from the User to any third parties without the User’s additional consent and without prior notification to the User.
7.4. The Licensor may assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement to any third parties without the User’s additional consent and without prior notification to the User. 

 <title>8. LIABILITY OF THE PARTIES </title> 8.1. If the User provides inaccurate information, threatens or insults the Licensor’s employees, violates the terms of this Offer or the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan, fails to fulfill or improperly fulfills obligations to pay the license fee and rent for the Charging Device, does not return it, or unlawfully retains it, the Licensor may restrict access to the “YOOU power” Platform. The restriction may take the form of blocking the User’s Profile or prohibiting the rental of the Charging Device until the violations are rectified. 
Blocking of the Profile may be applied under the following circumstances: 
• If the Licensor has reasonable suspicions of dishonest actions by the User (including, but not limited to, providing false data, inability to deduct payments, and other cases); 
• In case of the User’s non-compliance with the terms of the Agreement or the rules for using the Application;
• If the User has unpaid debt; 
• In case of rude or offensive behavior by the User towards the Licensor’s representatives, or use of obscene language when communicating with the Support Service;
• If the User attempted to mislead the Licensor, distort facts, or provide inaccurate information; 
• If a violation of the Agreement terms disrupts the Platform’s operation, hinders its use by other Users, causes damage to the Licensor, or precludes the possibility of further providing services to a specific User.
Blocking the Profile means restricting access to the Platform’s functionality, as a result of which the User will be unable to rent a Charging Device or perform other previously available actions. 
No separate notification of blocking is sent, as the inability to use the Platform serves as sufficient evidence of restricted access. 
Unblocking is possible after the expiration of the designated period, fulfillment of the User’s obligations, elimination of the reasons for blocking, or compliance with other requirements set by the Licensor. The decision to unblock the profile is made at the Licensor’s discretion. 
8.2. In case of damage, loss, or alteration of the appearance of the Charging Device (including affixing stickers, inscriptions, or other structural changes), the User is obliged to compensate for the caused damage. In this case, a penalty for loss is debited from the User’s bank card in the amount specified in the “YOOU power” Application as the current amount at the time of concluding the Rental, as well as the rental fee for 3 days of use of the Charging Device, calculated based on the current daily rate specified in the Application at the time of concluding the Rental. 
8.3. The use of the Charging Device for entrepreneurial or other commercial purposes is prohibited. If such actions are detected, the User is obliged to pay a penalty, and the Licensor is entitled to debit a penalty for loss from the User’s bank card in the amount specified in the “YOOU power” Application as the current amount at the time of concluding the Rental, as well as the rental fee for 3 days of use of the Charging Device, calculated based on the current daily rate specified in the Application at the time of concluding the Rental. 
8.4. In case of the User’s indebtedness to the Licensor for the rental of the Charging Device or other services, the Licensor is entitled to recover a penalty from the User in the amount of 1% of the debt amount for each day of payment delay (non-payment). The total amount of the penalty is not limited and will be accrued until the debt is fully repaid. 
8.5. In cases where the Licensee lacks sufficient personal data of the User to recover the debt through court proceedings, the User, by accepting the terms of this Agreement, consents to the Licensee obtaining the missing personal data from the User’s bank and/or other authorities and to the bank and/or other authorities disclosing such data without additional consent from the User. 
8.6. The Licensor may deduct rental fees from the User’s bank card until the Charging Device is returned to the Station or the order is closed through the Support Service. No maximum limit is set for deducting funds from bank cards for the use of the Charging Device. 
8.7. The Licensor is not liable for damage caused to the User’s property or health, or to the property or health of third parties, or for any other negative consequences arising from the use of the Charging Device in a faulty condition or failure to comply with the operating rules and safety measures specified in the Agreement. 
8.8. By accepting the terms of this Offer, the User confirms that: 
• They are the lawful owner of the phone number and bank card specified during registration; 
• They are aware of the risks of using someone else’s data and undertake to compensate for losses if their actions cause damage to the Licensor or the lawful owner of the bank card. 
8.9. Payment of fines, penalties, and interest is made automatically from the card linked to the Application. In the absence of sufficient funds on the card linked to the Application, the debt may be deducted from any other bank card registered in the User’s name, regardless of whether it is linked to the Application.
8.10. Interest for the Licensor’s use of the User’s funds, including funds deposited as a deposit, erroneously deducted payments, or in any other cases, is neither accrued nor paid.
8.11. In cases where the property rights to the Application and/or the “YOOU power” Trademark belong to the rightsholder, the User undertakes to protect, indemnify, and fully release the rightsholder, as well as its affiliates, employees, representatives, and partners (hereinafter referred to as “Protected Persons”) from any claims, lawsuits, demands, damages, fines, costs, expenses, and obligations (including court costs and reasonable legal service expenses) that may arise in connection with:
8.11.1. Use of the “YOOU power” Platform, including, but not limited to:
• Incorrect or illegal use of the Application, Telegram Bot, Stations, or other services provided by the rightsholder; 
• Violation by the User of the Offer terms, this Agreement, the Privacy Policy, and other documents regulating the Platform’s operation.
8.11.2. Use of Charging Devices, including, but not limited to: 
 • Damage, loss, or untimely return of the Charging Device;
• Use of the Charging Device for purposes other than intended or in violation of established safety measures;
• Non-compliance with the Charging Device’s operating conditions, resulting in its breakdown, damage, or harm to third-party property.
8.11.3. Claims from third parties related to the User’s actions, including, but not limited to:
• Causing damage to third parties while using the Platform, Stations, or Charging Devices;
• Violation by the User of third-party rights, legislation, or established usage rules.
8.11.4. Any other circumstances arising from the User’s actions or inaction, directly or indirectly related to the execution of the Agreement.
In case claims, demands, lawsuits, or other judicial or administrative proceedings related to the User’s actions are brought against the rightsholder, the User undertakes to: 
• Promptly provide all necessary information to protect the rightsholder;
• Compensate for all incurred expenses, including, but not limited to, amounts of fines, compensations, court costs, and other damages.
The User understands and accepts that the rightsholder is not liable for any consequences arising from the User’s violation of the Agreement, Offer, or other obligations, as well as from improper use of the Platform or Charging Devices.

 <title>9. LIMITATION OF LICENSOR’S LIABILITY</title>9.1. No provision of this Agreement limits or excludes the Licensor’s liability for: 
a) Death or harm to health resulting from the Licensor’s negligence, its employees, or agents, or from a defect in the Charging Device that was not obvious or hidden at the time of its receipt by the User; 
b) Fraud, intentional deception, or any other liability that cannot be limited or excluded under applicable legislation. 
9.2. Subject to the provisions of Clause 9.1, the User agrees that the Licensor’s maximum liability to them arising in connection with this Agreement is limited to an amount of 100,000 UZS.
9.3. In exchange for the provided opportunity to rent a Charging Device, the User (acting on their own behalf, as well as on behalf of their heirs, successors, representatives, and other interested parties) unconditionally and permanently releases the Licensor from any claims, demands, damages, obligations, and expenses (including court costs) that may arise in connection with:
a) Any services provided under this Agreement, including the use of Charging Devices and the Platform;
b) Personal use of the aforementioned services by the User.
c) This release from liability applies to any possible claims, including, but not limited to, those based on contractual, tortious (including negligence), or other grounds, and is applied to the fullest extent permitted by law.
9.4. The User acknowledges and agrees that, except as provided by applicable legislation, the Licensor is not liable for claims related to:
a) Any risks or hazards specified in this Agreement;
b) Use or inability to use the Platform, Charging Devices, or other Licensor services;
c) Violation by the User of the terms of this Agreement or applicable legislation;
d) Actions, inaction, negligence, or wrongful conduct of third parties.
The User fully releases the Licensor from any claims arising from the above grounds, including claims based on contract, tort (including negligence), law, or other grounds, even if the Licensor was notified of the possibility of such claims.
9.5. The User confirms and agrees that renting the Charging Device, using the Platform, and other Licensor services is undertaken solely at their own risk.
9.6. To the fullest extent permitted by law, the Licensor provides no express or implied warranties, including warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement. All Charging Devices and the Platform are provided “as is” and “as available”, without any warranties of functionality or uninterrupted operation.
9.7. The User assumes full responsibility for any delays, failures, omissions, inaccuracies, or other issues related to the operation of the Platform and services. The User also bears full responsibility for any consequences, including third-party claims, related to the loss or theft of the Charging Device in their possession during rental.
 <title>10. OWNERSHIP AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY</title>10.1. All Charging Devices, Stations, databases, and content are the property of the Licensor and are not transferred to the User’s ownership under any circumstances.
Renting a Charging Device grants the User only a limited (non-exclusive) right to temporary use, without conferring any property or other rights to the Charging Device. 
10.2. The software, Applications, “YOOU power” Platform, its design, content, interface program code, all logos, trademarks, and the Platform’s branding style belong to the Licensor under ownership rights and are used and/or transferred to Users on lawful grounds.
The User is granted only a limited (non-exclusive) right to temporary use, without conferring any property or other rights to the Charging Device.
10.3. The User is not entitled to:
• Copy, modify, distribute, reproduce, or use elements of the Platform’s intellectual property without the Licensor’s written permission;
• Remove, conceal, or alter any trademarks, logos, identifiers, or other branding elements placed on the Charging Devices or in the Application.
10.4. Use of the Platform, Charging Devices, Application, and other intellectual property objects for commercial purposes without the Licensor’s consent is prohibited.
10.5. Any violation of this section may entail liability in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan and this Agreement.

 <title>11. FORCE MAJEURE</title>11.1. The Licensor undertakes obligations to ensure the safety and reliable operation of the Platform in accordance with the law. However, the Licensor is not liable for damage, losses, or inconveniences arising from circumstances beyond its reasonable control, including, but not limited to:
• Technical maintenance of information network equipment;
• Connection failures, malfunctions of computers, communication systems, or other technical systems; 
• Power outages;
• Strikes, riots, military actions, terrorist acts;
• Natural disasters (fires, floods, hurricanes, earthquakes, etc.);
• Explosions, accidents, and technological disasters; 
• Actions of government authorities, judicial, or administrative bodies; 
 • Changes in legislation, regulations, or administrative orders;
• Actions or inaction of third parties resulting in the inability to fulfill obligations; 
• Hacker attacks, Platform breaches, cyberattacks, or other information security threats; 
• Any restrictions on the use of the “YOOU power” Platform and the “YOOU power” trademark by the rightsholder, in cases where the property rights to the Application and/or the “YOOU power” Trademark belong to the rightsholder;
• Loss of any and/or all rights of the rightsholder to the “YOOU power” Platform and the “YOOU power” trademark.
11.2. In the event of force majeure circumstances, the Licensor is released from liability for the entire duration of their effect and does not guarantee uninterrupted operation of the Platform, availability of Charging Devices, or the ability to fully fulfill all obligations to the User.
11.3. If such circumstances persist for an extended period (more than two calendar days), the Licensor may amend the terms of service provision or suspend their provision. 

 <title>12. PROCEDURE FOR AMENDING THE AGREEMENT  </title>12.1. The Licensor may unilaterally amend or supplement the terms of the Agreement and Rental without the need to separately notify the User. The Agreement is an open and accessible document, the current version of which is posted on the Internet at: <link2>https://yoou.uz/privacy</link2>. 
Users are recommended to regularly check updates to the Agreement terms. The posting of a new version of the Agreement or its amendments is considered an offer to the User to amend the Agreement terms.
If the User disagrees with the introduced changes, they must cease using the “YOOU power” Application.
12.2. The User independently monitors current information on the Licensor’s Website and in the Application.
If the User continues to use the Application, including renting a Charging Device, after the entry into force of a new version of the Agreement and/or changes to the Rental terms, such actions are deemed full and unconditional consent (acceptance) of the updated terms. 

 <title>13. DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCEDURE</title> 13.1. If the User has questions, claims, or doubts related to the operation of the “YOOU power” Application, payments, or fulfillment of obligations under this Agreement, and cannot resolve them independently through the information in the Application or by contacting the Support Service, they may submit a written request to the Licensor. 
13.2. The request must contain sufficient information to identify the User: 
• Data specified during registration in the Application;
• Full name and email address; 
• If the request concerns a payment refund — copies of documents confirming the payment. 
13.3. The claim must be signed by the User, scanned, and sent to the email address specified in the “Contacts” and/or “Contact Us” section. The original claim must also be sent via UzPost (JSC “O’zbekiston pochtasi”), delivered by courier, or handed over in person. 
13.4. The Licensor reviews the request within 10 (ten) calendar days. If a positive decision on a refund is made following the review, the crediting period depends on the rules of the internet acquiring system and the regulations of the bank servicing the User’s card. 
13.5. In the event of non-performance or improper performance of obligations under this Agreement by the User, the Licensor shall send a notice (claim) via the “YOOU power” application, send SMS messages, or call the User’s phone number with a demand to settle the debt. The User is deemed to have received such notice (claim) on the day it is sent or the call is made. The use of additional notification methods (such as email, etc.) remains at the Licensor’s discretion. 
13.6. If a dispute cannot be resolved pre-trial, it is subject to consideration in the court at the Licensor’s location, unless otherwise provided by the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan. 

 <title>14. OTHER CONDITIONS </title>14.1. Documents sent by the Parties via email have the same legal force as documents executed on paper and signed by hand, unless otherwise explicitly stated in the Agreement. 
14.2. Messages sent to an email address are deemed received at the moment of confirmation by the recipient or the postal service through which they were sent. 
14.3. By accepting the terms of the Offer, the User consents to the processing of their personal data by the Licensor and the rightsholder for the purposes of fulfilling the Agreement. The processing of personal data is governed by the Licensor’s Privacy Policy, published on the Website/Application.

User Agreement 

1. GENERAL This Agreement creates binding legal obligations on you. If you do not agree to any of the terms of this Agreement, please do not access the Platforms, use any of the services offered through the Platforms or register an account for such services. 

1.1 These terms and conditions constitute the agreement (“Agreement”) between you (“User”) and POWER DISTRIBUTIONS LLC. and our affiliates (“we,” “us,” or “YOOU share”) regarding your use of our YOOU share power bank renting service (“Service”) in the UZBEKISTAN, and applies to our website https://yoou.uz/ (“Website”) and to the YOOU application for mobile devices (“YOOU share App”) using operating systems such as IOS, Android, and/or Windows Mobile (the Website and the YOOU share App are collectively called the “Platform”).

(c) your use of the Service does not violate any applicable law or regulation.

3.3 After registering an Account by phone number, you link your bank card, from which a deposit is withdrawn for using the service, as well as subsequent payments for renting devices. 

3.4 After successfully completing the User registration process, you may start using the Service through the Platform in accordance with this Agreement. 

3.5 We reserve the right to suspend, deny or revoke your access to your Account, the Platform and/or the Service at any time and at our sole discretion. If you are suspended, or have been denied or had your access revoked you may lodge a User complaint in accordance with the procedures set out in this Agreement. 

4. ACCOUNT SECURITY 

4.1 You are responsible for the security of your Account including login information and password(s). Please ensure that you log out at the end of each session when using the Website and leave the Platform following the correct steps. If you disclose your Account information you may be responsible for any losses and consequences of such acts. 

4.2 Subject to Clause 10.1 of this Agreement, you shall be responsible for all the actions and results carried out under your Account (including, but not limited to, using YOOU share power banks (“YOOU share Power Banks”), returning YOOU share Power Banks, releasing information, disclosing information, opening your address book) whether the actions and results have caused any damage to yourself, us or a third party.

(d) to comply with all applicable laws and the terms and conditions in this Agreement in connection with your Account.

(a) After registrations, users should enable GPS on their phone to use our service. By clicking ‘unlock’ in the App users can scan the QR code on the station and the Power Bank will be automatically released. 

(b) Before you use a YOOU share power bank, you must carefully inspect it for any damage, including, but not limited to, cable presence, cable condition, battery level functionality etc. 

(c) You must promptly notify YOOU share of any problem or issue with the power bank via the YOOU share App or customer service email: info@yoou.uz, Call centre: +998 99 197 04 04 

(d) Subject to Clause 10.1 of this Agreement, if you proceed to use a YOOU share power bank in circumstances where:

(g) You may not hire out a YOOU share power bank to anyone else, nor may you use a YOOU share power bank for conducting any business activity. 

(h) After each use of the YOO shared power supply, you can end the rental period by returning the power supply to the station (the rental period ends automatically in the app) to stop the timer countdown and pay the corresponding rental fees. 

(i) The data generated by the Platform is conclusive evidence of the period of your use of a YOOU share power bank. Your use of any YOOU share power bank is limited to a period of 72 consecutive hours. Any use that exceeds a period of 72 consecutive hours is deemed a disappearance of the YOOU share power bank until the YOOU share Power Bank is checked back in. If a YOOU share power bank is not returned and checked in within a period of 72 consecutive hours, then the YOOU share Power Bank is deemed lost or purchased and your Account may be charged a lost battery fee of up to 150 000 UZS. If a YOOU share Power Bank is lost while you are using it, you must report the disappearance by filing a formal police report with the local police and also notify us within 24 hours following the disappearance via the Platform. 

(j) In addition to, and not intended to limit, any other restrictions in connection with your use of a YOOU share Power Bank, you may not: 

(ii) Modify, dismantle, write on, attach accessories to or otherwise alter or deface a YOOU share Power Bank or any part of a YOOU share Power Bank in any way, or use a YOOU share Power Bank for any advertising or similar commercial purpose;

(ii) you acknowledge that YOOU share does not guarantee that you will be able to return the power bank at all times once it has been rented, if all stations in the users vicinity are full of power banks. If this does occur, please contact support via the app.

For more information or if you are involved in an accident or damage or injury is caused to someone or something while using a YOOU share Power Bank, please contact us at info@yoou.uz or via the Platform.

(b) You may also make a deposit into your account and replenish your account using certain payment services.Your account will be debited for your use of YOOU share Power Banks. When there is insufficient balance on your account, you may use YOOU share Power Banks on credit for one time before you will be allowed to use the batteries again only when your account is replenished. 

(c) Please note that you may not withdraw money from your account under any circumstances. There are no refunds of any amount in your account balance once deposited. 

(d) A refund of the deposit is possible in the Application after payment of existing debts. While the deposit is in the possession of OOO “POWER DISTRIBUTIONS” and until it is returned to you, the company has the right to use the amount received at its discretion. 

7.4 In the event that you dispute any charge on your credit or debit card or to your Account, then you should contact us at info@yoou.uz as soon as you become aware of a disputed charge. 

8. COMPLAINTS

9. BREACH

(b) We may suspend your Account or permanently block you from using the Platform. 

9.2 After any of the above actions is taken, we will text you a notification message. If you have any question regarding our handling of your violation, you may appeal to our customer service email at info@yoou.uz
